newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia August housing finance rose 0.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia August housing finance rose 0.8 pct.

text.p: Finance commitments for owner-occupied housing in Australia rose 0.8 percent by volume to 40,602 dwellings in August, seasonally-adjusted, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said.
In value terms, housing finance rose to A$4.03 billion in August from A$4.00 billion in July, the bureau said.
Analysts forecasts had centered on a 1.5 percent fall in commitments for August.
The Bureau said financing by banks rose 0.8 percent in August, while financing by building societies fell 7.8 percent and other lenders rose 4.7 percent, seasonally adjusted.
The bureau said the overall financing rise in August was mainly attributable to a 10.4 percent rise in refinancing commitments.
It said the number of dwelling units financed in August was 9.6 percent up on the year.
